item.title: Report X-2023080785
item.description:
Report X-2023080785

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: GRAND RAPIDS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET BOX WAS FOUND DURING THE LOADING PROCESS AND PUT IN A HAZMAT TOTE THEN BROUGHT OVER FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION IT WAS FOUND TO BE A DAMAGED HAZMAT AND THE HAZMAT PROCESS WAS STARTED. DescribePack: CAP / SEAL HAD FALLEN OFF CAUSING IT TO LEAK. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: BOX WAS TURNED RIGHT SIDE UP ACCORDING TO THE DIRECTIONAL ARROWS PRINTED ON THE BOX.

item.description:
Report X-2023080715

  • City: SALINE
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be wet when attempting to load onto a truck for delivery. DescribePack: One bottle is cracked on the bottom due to an impact, allowing all of the contents to leak. The outer package has no markings, LQ or otherwise. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a plastic bin to contain the leak.

item.title: Report X-2023080689
item.description:
Report X-2023080689

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: LANSING
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The outer pkg contained 4 plastic jugs of chemical drain cleaner. The jugs had screw-on caps. At some point during the pkg's shipment the vibration of transit caused the jugs' screw-on caps to loosen. 3 of the jugs' caps were only slightly loose while the 4th jug's cap was found completely off the jug. Chemical odor and pkg dampness prompted inspection at the delivery station. The pkg was placed in a plastic tub when first discovered and was sent to the station's QA area for eventual inspection and processing. DescribePack: Again, vessels that employ screw-on caps are prone to having the caps loosen from the vibration of transit alone. 3 of the 4 jugs' caps were found to be slightly loose - the 4th jug's cap was completely off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The caps on the jugs were tightened, the jugs were wiped down with paper towels, and contaminated cardboard was contained in a plastic tub.

item.title: Report X-2023080993
item.description:
Report X-2023080993

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: LIVONIA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY THE HAZMAT AUDITOR TO CONTAIN TWO AEROSOL SPRAY CANS. THE OUTER PACKAGE HAD NO HAZARDOUS WARNING LABELS OR ANY OTHER INDICATION THAT THE PACKAGE CONTAINED AEROSOL SPRAY CANS. PACKAGE IS BEING HELD IN THE HAZMAT AUDITORS CAGE.

item.title: Report E-2023080607
item.description:
Report E-2023080607

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: ALPENA
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was attempting to deliver gasoline into the customer's above-ground storage tank. The driver inadvertently had the pump reversed and instead of pushing product from the trailer into the storage tank, it was pulling gasoline from the storage tank onto the trailer. This resulted in the trailer over-filling and approximately 50 gallons of gasoline being released. Northern A-1 Environmental responded and handled the remediation.
